column1: Open gallbladder removal is surgery to remove the gallbladder through a large cut in your abdomen.
You may need this surgery if you have pain or other symptoms from gallstones.

Other reasons for removing the gallbladder by open surgery: - Unexpected bleeding during the laparoscopic operation - Obesity - Pancreatitis (inflammation in the pancreas) - Pregnancy (third trimester) - Severe liver problems - Past surgeries in the same area of your belly

Risks of anesthesia and surgery in general are: - Reactions to medicines - Breathing problems - Bleeding, blood clots - Infection Risks of gallbladder surgery are: - Damage to the blood vessels that go to the liver - Injury to the common bile duct - Injury to the small or large intestine - Pancreatitis (inflammation of the pancreas)
